title: Clarity on "tank meta", and why it is unlikely
body:
There seems to be confusion about what this means. A tank meta is not tanks being viable, that is a healthy meta. Just as an ADC meta is not ADCs being viable, that is a healthy meta. This applies to every class in the game.

A tank meta, or any class meta. Means those champions have so much agency over games that they are not only present in every match but are the dominant picks in every match.

For example. The ADC meta we would have Graves jungle, Draven ADC, Ezreal mid and Vayne top. That is UNHEALTHY.

But the exact same goes for a tank meta. When every game would be like. Mundo top, Sejauni jungle, Nautilus support. Stacked to the max to where they made everything but tank busters unviable or nearly unviable.

A healthy meta is one where the most number of classes are effective. Without being too strong. This should be the aim of balance. Not to make any class dominant.

That said. I am indifferent and unafraid in regards to a "tank meta". As it just means I can get freelo picking Gnar, Fiora, Vayne or whatever. Plus I doubt a true tri-tank meta will ever actually happen again. Riot has quite intentionally made Pen, Shred, Max HP, True Damage and Current HP all easy to access. In addition they made offense clearly outscale defense.

The only way a tank meta would succeed these days would be if they all had overloaded base damage like Poppy. And then it would just be taking the place of the toxic diver/fighter meta we are in.

That said. Damage needs to go down. See my post on "League, then vs now". But a highly unlikely tank meta is not the savior you are looking for.

Thank you for reading. I hope this provided some clarity on what a tank meta is and why it is unlikely.

replies.body: Exactly this. The point of the Vanguard update is that since carries do so much damage, tanks need to be brought up to speed with the carry classes. Modernized kits and items should make tanks healthy and viable, not necessarily overwhelming. I highly doubt this will result in a "tank meta".

It is a strange fetish the world has for extremes. They suffer one thing for a short period and forget how bad the other was(Grass is always greener on the other side of the hill). They get indignant about it. Instead of wanting to fix problems they want revenge(an eye for an eye makes the whole world blind).

It would be like having a car where one tire is low on air. But instead of wanting to fix it you get mad that one side was higher for a while so you pop the full tire and over inflate the low tired.

It is unhealthy behavior and doesn't make anything better. It just puffs up one side for a short while while deflating the other side.

See-saw balance needs to go. True nirvana is achieved through symmetry.

Indeed, a wise statement. First "assassins have no counterplay". Now "assassins have too much counterplay, adcs are op". Now people are pretty much wishing for the tank meta. As if they forget early season 6 and tank metas before. Mundo and Garen chasing through 3 towers. As an adc, if a tank had thornmail you could auto them while they are standing still doing nothing and** the adc would die from thornmail**.

Edit: Mundo and Garen are  juggernauts but were able to take advantage and become unkillable, further validating that a tank meta was in place.
